summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T Corporation, demanding subscriber records for specific IP addresses from August 10, 2019, and broader call detail records from January 1, 2014 onward. The document includes a confidentiality request and a declaration form for a custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying confidentiality request letter.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to AT&T
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to AT&T Corporation, demanding extensive subscriber and call records related to specific IP addresses from August 10, 2019.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commanded AT&T to appear before the grand jury on this date, though appearance could be avoided by producing the requested records in advance.

locations: National Compliance Center AT&T Corporation, 11760 U.S. Highway 1, North Palm Beach, FL 33408
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks extensive AT&T subscriber data for specific IP addresses from August 10, 2019, including names, addresses, payment methods, and call detail records from January 1, 2014 onward.
The investigation relates to alleged violations of federal statutes including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), false statements (18 U.S.C. ยง 1001), and destruction of records (18 U.S.C. ยง 1519).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested AT&T keep the subpoena confidential to preserve the investigation.
The document is dated August 14, 2019, indicating active grand jury investigation at that time.
The subpoena reference number is 2019R01059, linking it to a specific investigative matter.
